title: Result suppression issues

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

labels.name: severity-minor
labels.description: a problem which doesn't affect the package's usefulness, and is presumably trivial to fix

body:
I've noticed a couple of rough edges with the recent "suppress similar results" feature.

For demonstration purposes, here's a script saves a number of files equal to the number passed as the first argument.

<details>
<summary>script</summary>

```sh
#!/bin/sh

set -eu

cd "$(mktemp -d --tmpdir dl-XXXXXXX)"
datalad create >/dev/null 2>&1

ntimes=${1:-20}
for i in $(seq 1 "$ntimes")
do
    echo "$i content" >foo-$(printf "%03d" $i)
done

echo "There are $(find . -name "foo-*" | wc -l) files to save\n"
datalad save
```

</details>

All the output below is with 0.12.4-574-gcedcb9e69f.

For ten files, I expected to see all those files.  That's what happens, but there is also a message about -1 suppressed messages.

```
There are 10 files to save

add(ok): foo-001 (file)
add(ok): foo-002 (file)
add(ok): foo-003 (file)
add(ok): foo-004 (file)
add(ok): foo-005 (file)
add(ok): foo-006 (file)
add(ok): foo-007 (file)
add(ok): foo-008 (file)
add(ok): foo-009 (file)
add(ok): foo-010 (file)
  [-1 similar messages have been suppressed]
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 10)
  save (ok: 1)
```

There is a similar negative number count below the suppression threshold of 10:

```
There are 5 files to save

add(ok): foo-001 (file)
add(ok): foo-002 (file)
add(ok): foo-003 (file)
add(ok): foo-004 (file)
add(ok): foo-005 (file)
  [-6 similar messages have been suppressed]
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 5)
  save (ok: 1)
```

Right above the limit, there is an odd 0 count:

```
There are 11 files to save

add(ok): foo-001 (file)
add(ok): foo-002 (file)
add(ok): foo-003 (file)
add(ok): foo-004 (file)
add(ok): foo-005 (file)
add(ok): foo-006 (file)
add(ok): foo-007 (file)
add(ok): foo-008 (file)
add(ok): foo-009 (file)
add(ok): foo-010 (file)
add(ok): foo-011 (file)
  [0 similar messages have been suppressed]
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 11)
  save (ok: 1)
```

Once we get to 12, things look pretty good, though I think the intent was for the results to start being suppress at 10 rather 11.

```
There are 12 files to save

add(ok): foo-001 (file)
add(ok): foo-002 (file)
add(ok): foo-003 (file)
add(ok): foo-004 (file)
add(ok): foo-005 (file)
add(ok): foo-006 (file)
add(ok): foo-007 (file)
add(ok): foo-008 (file)
add(ok): foo-009 (file)
add(ok): foo-010 (file)
add(ok): foo-011 (file)
  [1 similar messages have been suppressed]
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 12)
  save (ok: 1)
```
